name: Windcliff Lookouts
economy_niches: pilotage and lookout-guides for approaching ships
culture_adjustments: apprenticeship focused on solitary lookout duty and whistle-sign codes
rope-and-net rites adapted to cliff-top safety and signaling
stronger clan-like ties among pilot guilds than merchant houses
practical austerity: lightweight, portable household culture
dialectal whistles and concise Coastal Tongue commands common
constraints: dependence on coastal shipping for supplies
no large shipyards due to cliff terrain
ritual magic requires scarce imported reagents
notes: serves as strategic early-warning chain for State_9 ports
watchtowers double as minor augury shrines and pilot lodges
few permanent burgs; seasonal crews and rotating watches common
